channel.title: BBC News - Health

item.title: Long Covid funding to unearth new treatments
item.description: Researchers from across the UK will investigate everything from brain fog to ongoing breathlessness.

item.title: Covid: Vaccine offered to all UK adults, says government
item.description: More than two-thirds of people have had both doses as England prepares for rules to ease on Monday.

item.title: 'Working in Mum's care home brought us closer'
item.description: Lydia Loader, whose mother Sally has dementia, heard her speak for the first time in 18 months.

item.title: England plans biggest winter flu vaccine rollout
item.description: Free jabs will be offered to more than 35 million people, including more teenagers than ever before.

item.title: Covid: Fully jabbed arrivals from France must still quarantine
item.description: A planned relaxation of England's rules from Monday will not apply due to cases of the Beta variant.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Unvaccinated patients with many regrets
item.description: The number of Covid patients in Bradford Royal Infirmary is rising sharply - and half are unvaccinated.

item.title: Covid: UK daily cases pass 50,000 for first time since January
item.description: It comes after England's chief medical officer warned hospitalisations could hit "scary numbers".

item.title: Covid infections are high and rising around the UK
item.description: Cases have risen again in many regions, data reveals, ahead of England dropping most Covid rules on Monday.

item.title: Covid: Younger adults still at risk of serious organ damage - study
item.description: Adults below the age of 50 are almost as likely to suffer from medical complications as the over-50s.

item.title: Winter vomiting virus warning for England
item.description: Cases of norovirus are going up with a number of outbreaks caused by the vomiting bug in recent weeks, say officials.

item.title: Covid hospital numbers could get scary - Prof Chris Whitty
item.description: It comes as the UK recorded almost 50,000 new cases on Thursday - the highest number since January.

item.title: UK weather: Heat-health alert issued in England for weekend
item.description: Public Heath England wants people to look out for those who may be at risk in warmer weather.

item.title: Medics fear surge in winter viruses alongside Covid
item.description: A potential triple whammy of viruses prompts calls for more testing to reduce spread this autumn.

item.title: 'Virginity-repair' surgery set to be banned
item.description: Plans to outlaw the practice in England and Wales have been tabled in Parliament.

item.title: National Food Strategy: Tax sugar and salt and prescribe veg, report says
item.description: Boris Johnson says he will consider the proposal, but finds the idea of extra taxes on people unattractive.

item.title: Covid: Mandatory isolation scrapped for unvaccinated close contacts
item.description: Those not fully vaccinated will be asked to test at home as an alternative to mandatory isolation.

item.title: Almost 7,000 waiting for lifesaving transplants
item.description: Despite services recovering quickly there are still thousands waiting for organs, report says.

item.title: Covid-19 rules: How six countries fared after easing Covid rules
item.description: As England approaches an end to social contact laws, how have other countries managed?

item.title: NHS Covid app: Should it stay or should it go?
item.description: There is a clash over the future of the NHS tracing app, as many delete it - or ignore its alerts.

item.title: Dying too young: Maps show little has changed in 170 years
item.description: Why do areas with high Covid death rates match places with the worst health in Victorian times?

item.title: Covid-19: 'For us it's not freedom day, is it?'
item.description: Their medical conditions mean they are considered vulnerable to Covid. How are they feeling now?

item.title: 'Holiday food poisoning left me paralysed'
item.description: Malcolm Brown developed a rare autoimmune disease after suffering food poisoning while on a self-catering trip.

item.title: Marr on catching Covid after being double vaccinated
item.description: The BBC's Andrew Marr fell ill with Covid-19, despite being vaccinated twice.

item.title: Your questions about vaccines and periods answered
item.description: Find out what experts believe the short and long term effects of a covid jab will be on your period.

item.title: Long Covid: 'I've blood clots, a braced leg and damaged heart... but I'm home'
item.description: For three months, Bill Wilson lived a nightmare, trapped behind a plastic facemask fighting Covid.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Covid: What do over-18s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now available for younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: How many cases in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: What are the India, Brazil, South Africa and UK variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: The PM says every adult should have had the chance to be doubled jabbed by mid-September.

item.title: How do we know Covid vaccines are safe?
item.description: Busting myths and explaining the facts around vaccines.

item.title: South Africa coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: Why experts are concerned about the emergence of this particular new version of coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
item.description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

item.title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
item.description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

item.title: How to get a Covid test
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: All you need to know on the coronavirus
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
item.description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
item.description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?
item.description: With face masks in high demand, we look at whether they really can protect people from the virus.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How are young people responding to the jab?
item.description: The Covid vaccine is now being offered to all over 18s. So what has uptake been like for young people?

item.title: Covid: Coping with opening-up anxiety
item.description: Lauren and Angelica-Jane fear the end of restrictions will be challenging for their mental health.

item.title: Lisa Shaw death: 'Give people choice over type of Covid jab'
item.description: Gareth Eve’s wife, BBC Newcastle presenter Lisa Shaw, died in hospital after a bleed on the brain.

item.title: Covid patient’s own blood cells could treat lung scarring
item.description: A therapy made from a patient’s white blood cells is being trialled by doctors in London.

item.title: Menopause: Swansea MP calls for change on 'the change'
item.description: Campaigners want women to talk about the menopause and call for more training for GPs.
